p: Use the Matthew Bender® Sources page to select the Matthew Bender sources you want to search. You can search for a source or just browse through the list to find the one you want to use.

uicontrol.#tail: to select it. A search box appears, showing the source you selected. When you have finished selecting sources, select a date restriction if available, enter your search terms and select the search icon (

p: The Matthew Bender Sources page your firm is using may or may not have all of the features described below.
section.note: Source names displayed in orange are not within your subscription.  There is no charge to search in these sources, but there may be a charge for transactional documents you choose to view.

propdesc.#text: Enter the name or partial name of a source you want to use, and select

property.propvalue: Select a letter of the alphabet to view sources.

propdesc.p: Select a letter to display all the sources that begin with a specific letter.
propdesc.note: On the Jurisdiction tool, the sources are listed by jurisdiction.  On the Practice Area tool, the sources are listed by practice area.

property.propvalue: Add source as a search filter
property.propdesc: Click this link under a source name to add it to your search.
Click this icon next to a source name to view information about the source.
Click this link under a source name to view the table of contents for the source.
Select a date restriction (if available on the search box) if desired.
Click this on the search box to start your search.
Click this to clear all your selections.
